properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a List object to verify the connection between the add-in and Word, then use it to load and log list properties.
Retrieve and display the ID of the first list in the document to identify it for future operations

properties.name: levelExistences
properties.description: Checks whether each of the 9 levels exists in the list. A true value indicates the level exists, which means there is at least one list item at that level.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the level types and level existences information for the first list in the document.

properties.name: levelTypes
properties.description: Gets all 9 level types in the list. Each type can be 'Bullet', 'Number', or 'Picture'.

examples.description: Retrieve and display the level types and level existences information for the first list in the document.
Get all paragraphs from the first list in the document and log their text content to the console.

methods.name: getLevelFont
methods.description: Gets the font of the bullet, number, or picture at the specified level in the list.

examples.description: Get the font of the list items at level 0 and change its color to red

methods.name: getLevelParagraphs
methods.description: Gets the paragraphs that occur at the specified level in the list.

examples.description: Get all paragraphs at level 1 in the first list and highlight them in yellow

methods.name: getLevelPicture
methods.description: Gets the Base64-encoded string representation of the picture at the specified level in the list.

examples.description: Get the picture used as a bullet for level 1 items in the first list and display it in the console

methods.name: getLevelString
methods.description: Gets the bullet, number, or picture at the specified level as a string.

examples.description: Get the numbering format string for level 1 of the first list in the document and display it in the console.

methods.name: insertParagraph
methods.description: Inserts a paragraph at the specified location.

params.name: paragraphText
params.description: The paragraph text to be inserted.

examples.description: Create a new list from the second paragraph, add list items at the start and end with different list levels, and insert a paragraph after the list that is not part of it.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

examples.description: Load and display the font name of each paragraph in the first list of the document

methods.name: resetLevelFont
methods.description: Resets the font of the bullet, number, or picture at the specified level in the list.

params.name: resetFontName
params.description: Indicates whether to reset the font name. Default is false that indicates the font name is kept unchanged.

examples.description: Reset the font formatting of level 1 list items to the default font in the first list of the document

methods.name: setLevelAlignment
methods.description: Sets the alignment of the bullet, number, or picture at the specified level in the list.

params.name: alignment
params.description: The level alignment that must be 'Left', 'Centered', or 'Right'.

params.name: alignment
params.description: The level alignment that must be 'Left', 'Centered', or 'Right'.

examples.description: Set the alignment of level 1 list items to center and level 2 list items to right in the first list of the document

methods.name: setLevelBullet
methods.description: Sets the bullet format at the specified level in the list. If the bullet is 'Custom', the charCode is required.

params.name: charCode
params.description: The bullet character's code value. Used only if the bullet is 'Custom'.

params.name: fontName
params.description: The bullet's font name. Used only if the bullet is 'Custom'.

params.name: charCode
params.description: The bullet character's code value. Used only if the bullet is 'Custom'.

params.name: fontName
params.description: The bullet's font name. Used only if the bullet is 'Custom'.

examples.description: Set the bullet type to arrow for list level 5 in a Word document list.

methods.name: setLevelIndents
methods.description: Sets the two indents of the specified level in the list.

params.name: textIndent
params.description: The text indent in points. It is the same as paragraph left indent.

params.name: bulletNumberPictureIndent
params.description: The relative indent, in points, of the bullet, number, or picture. It is the same as paragraph first line indent.

examples.description: Set the indents for level 1 of the first list in the document, with a text indent of 0.5 inches and a bullet/number indent of 0.25 inches

methods.name: setLevelNumbering
methods.description: Sets the numbering format at the specified level in the list.

params.name: formatString
params.description: The numbering string format defined as an array of strings and/or integers. Each integer is a level of number type that is higher than or equal to this level. For example, an array of ["(", level - 1, ".", level, ")"] can define the format of "(2.c)", where 2 is the parent's item number and c is this level's item number.

params.name: formatString
params.description: The numbering string format defined as an array of strings and/or integers. Each integer is a level of number type that is higher than or equal to this level. For example, an array of ["(", level - 1, ".", level, ")"] can define the format of "(2.c)", where 2 is the parent's item number and c is this level's item number.

examples.description: Configure a list with Arabic numbering for level 1, add new items at the start and end of the list, and set the last item to level 5 with an arrow bullet type.

methods.name: setLevelPicture
methods.description: Sets the picture at the specified level in the list.

params.name: base64EncodedImage
params.description: The Base64-encoded image to be set. If not given, the default picture is set.

examples.description: Set a custom image as the bullet picture for level 0 items in the first list of the document

methods.name: setLevelStartingNumber
methods.description: Sets the starting number at the specified level in the list. Default value is 1.

examples.description: Set the starting number of level 1 to 5 and level 2 to 10 in the first list of the document

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.List object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.ListData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Serialize a list object to JSON format to log or export its properties for debugging purposes.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

examples.description: Track a list object across multiple sync calls to maintain its reference while modifying list properties and paragraphs

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for [context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject)](/en-us/javascript/api/office/officeextension.clientrequestcontext#office-officeextension-clientrequestcontext-trackedobjects-member). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.

examples.description: Get a list from the document, use it to retrieve paragraph information, then release it from memory tracking to improve performance.
